subhead: Hosting the summit, Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney welcomed Volodymr Zelensky on Tuesday and announced Can$2 billion of military support, including drones and helicopters, for Ukraine.

title: Spain blames 'overvoltage' for huge April blackout
subhead: Spanish authorities had scrambled to find answers after the April 28 outage cut internet and telephone connections, halted trains, shut businesses and plunged cities into darkness across Spain and Portugal as well as briefly affecting southwestern France.

title: The failure of Obama's 'leading from behind' in Libya
subhead: 'The Transatlantic Divorce' (2/5). Elected on the promise of no longer sending American troops to the Middle East, President Barack Obama allowed France and the UK to lead the Libyan operation, which resulted in Muammar Gaddafi's fall. He emerged deeply frustrated by the shortcomings of his European allies.

title: Beloved black Corsican beaches threatened by nickel mining project
subhead: Nickel, essential for the electric battery sector, is present in the sand of the artificial beaches of Nonza and Albo, in northern Corsica. A recent mining project has sparked widespread opposition from local residents, who are deeply attached to these beaches, shaped by the region's industrial past.

title: 'Netanyahu called Trump's bluff' by striking Iran
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, Kamala Harris's former national security adviser criticizes the concept of 'peace through strength' that underpins current American foreign policy. He also acknowledges the Biden administration's mistakes, particularly in the war in Gaza.

title: The son's suicide, the father's murder and the tormented killer
subhead: Samuel Matias Batista is on trial in southwestern France for the 2019 killing of Guy Lecomte, whom he held responsible for his friend Danaël's 2015 suicide. The murderer has proven to be articulate and transparent regarding his criminal act.
